ygData.subject: Re: get this
ygData.msgSnippet: sounds like something to try, thanx for sharing.. ... From: Jeremy Stovall  To: Steven E. Phipps   Sent: Wednesday,
ygData.messageBody:
sounds like something to try, thanx for sharing..
----- Original Message -----
From: Jeremy Stovall <jeremy@...>
To: 'Steven E. Phipps ' <phipps@...>
Sent: Wednesday, May 05, 1999 12:55 PM
Subject: RE: [shadowknight] get this


> Actually, yes I will. The secret is the timing of the attacks. First
off,
> I try not to start the fights unless I have my harm touch, i.e. the
> emergency button, but it's not really necessary. The trick to it is you
> can't just leave your auto-attack on. I have a troll, and what I do is
wait
> until I have my opponent right in front of me, and then hit both my attack
> and my bash, followed by immediately turning auto-attack off. Then I wait
> for my next swing until I have him in my scopes again. For a wizard of
> comparable level, pulling this off just a few times is as much as winning
> the battle.
>
> Now, this isn't going to do you much good against a root spell, but you'd
be
> surprised how fast your wizard oppenent will start running once you hit
him
> with a harm touch. They will tend to panic, believing you probably can
deal
> out more of the same lvl of damage. While this will not win the fight, it
> will save your ass.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Steven E. Phipps
> To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> Sent: 5/5/99 10:58 AM
> Subject: Re: [shadowknight] get this
>
> From: "Steven E. Phipps" <phipps@...>
>
> ermm, wanna share your secret?
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Jeremy Stovall <jeremy@...>
> To: 'Steven E. Phipps ' <phipps@...>
> Sent: Wednesday, May 05, 1999 12:01 PM
> Subject: RE: [shadowknight] get this
>
>
> > I'm on Rallos Zek and make a habit out of killing light race wizards,
> among
> > other things.
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Steven E. Phipps
> > To: shadowknight@onelist.com
> > Sent: 5/5/99 7:18 AM
> > Subject: Re: [shadowknight] get this
> >
> > From: "Steven E. Phipps" <phipps@...>
> >
> > I have also been told that everquest has never been balanced for
> pkill,
> > it
> > is not a pkill game, that was just thrown is as a request from some
> > customers. The classes are balanced for grouping, but not for pkill. I
> > have
> > also read that all tank types are getting smashed by pkill, as the
> mage
> > types target you... and blast you..you however have to stay on them in
> > order
> > to hit them...if you have ever followed someone, expecially someone
> > trying
> > to avoid you(zigging and zagging) it is very hard for you to hit them.
> > As
> > soon as the mage gets away from you he zaps you, and he does not even
> > have
> > to have you on his screen. All that I have read confirms this...If you
> > think
> > chasing a monster down to hit him is hard, try chasing a player...
> > Throw in also pets, roots, sow etc...ermm...
> > EQ was not desighned for pkill...try it, you will find the warr types
> > are no
> > match.
> > Morgul
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
> > To: <shadowknight@onelist.com>
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 04, 1999 5:50 PM
> > Subject: Re: [shadowknight] get this
> >
> >
> > > From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
> > >
> > > I believe too that the Druid probably should have won, but it should
> > at
> > > least have been a fight.
> > >
> > > It sounds like the SK was used to mop the floor.
> > >
> > > And the HT did an absolutely pitiful amount of damage.
> > > Which brings me back to my original complaints about the
> unreliability
> > > or our "special" weapon.
> > >
> > > Of course this does all depend on the types of weapons and armor
> both
> > > had and their skills in their weapon's type, offense and defense.
> > >
> > > But i have a feeling that the buffing skills of druids are just way
> > > more effective than any damage the SK could have done with his
> spells.
> > > Since a druid will do the same amount of melee damage with a chosen
> > > weapon as a SK, they have a distinct advantage.
> > >
> > > But we already know that SKs will be considerably weaker than most
> > > other classes at low-mid levels.
> > > I would like to hear from a SK 30+ and see if the clouds lining gets
> > > any shinier.
> > >
> > > Bathory
> > > Cazic-Thule
